Experienced and new players are welcome to join this grand adventure.

Become a cult leader in Arkham working to achieve the required points to achieve victory over competing cults in this “old school” strategy and combat game for up to 4 players. Using their cult’s action dice, the players will move their cultists around Arkham locations where to perform actions, fight other cults, complete the active objectives or ceremonies. Designer Richard Launius will teach the game, so no experienced is required.
Build a mining colony on a distant planet in this game from Dr. Finn's Games.

Join up to 24 other drivers in the annual superspeedway race where each player uses their Driver Deck to maneuver their race car on the track to make lap count, pass, draft, pull away, bump draft, and occasionally crash in the annual event that has proven to be a racing fan (and gamer) favorite each year at Dicetower. Players will have to work together to get to the front, time their pit stop or try to make it to the finish on fumes, but regardless of racers cooperating on the final laps it is every driver fighting for position. The game is for experienced and rookie drivers as the rules will be covered by the host Richard Launius in the driver’s meeting at the start of the race.

Join an adventure from the Horrific Journeys as you travel out of Arkham and into new mysteries. The adventure is for 5 players taking on the roles of adventurous investigators thrust into a new threat of the mythos. It will take everything from arcane rituals down to the very suitcases the investigators carry to defeat the ancient threats. New and experienced players are welcome to join Richard Launius for this game.

Travel back in time to 1987 to play an upgraded art version of the original Arkham Horror. The game mechanics are simpler, but the adventure and threat remains the same. Designer Richard Launius will lead 8 investigators to cooperatively face the mythos threat released on Arkham. No experienced required. Note: If we exceed the number of players since this game may finish in 2 hours, a second game may be started at 10 PM for those willing to be in Arkham until the witching hour.
